sourceDesc.p: B-J SMOKE SIGNALS By Red Cloud

body.p: John Swallow has been retired from the government forces and pensioned off. HE has been working on the WPA. Moses Decorah says that apparently some of the boys from the Indian Mission are taking up aviation. One sees them frequently around the “Air-port.” We give to necessity the praise of virtue even after she mothered the inventions of warfare to slaughter off the sons of mothers. Good defrosters on cars give us the idea that what this country needs is a weatherman with a good defroster when winter comes. Of all the words of men and pen none is so forceful and far reaching in helping the farmer than the mere phrase of “Use lots o’ butter”. Thursday will be another anniversary for the first batch of port sausage-Feb. 2nd, ground hog day. Probably gigs will fly their flags half mast. TO close the last two days of January, I want to thank everybody for all the kind letters sent in. I got both of them. That’s getting up in the world, isn’t it? .
